history.content:
Hello!

 

I am a sophomore, intending to declare Data Science this semester, and I want to start a petition to expand the CS C8 class.

 

While I already know that administration has closed the class, I have found the reasons insufficient, and heard many on the wait list in dire situation, and am thus asking for another reconsideration.

 

I phase 2'ed CS C8 because I, like many other students, was under the impression that it would be expanded like CS61A and CS61B to accommodate all its students. Given its popularity (as well as it being a lower division requirement for the Data Science major as well as an introductory course to CS61A) and precedents of accommodating all wishing, my assumption was not groundless.

 

Yet the first Piazza post that announced that CS C8 would not be expanded came after phase 1. Had I known that the class would not be enlarged, I would have phase 1'ed it as I need it to declare my Data Science major this semester. Now if I don't take the class this semester I won't be able to graduate on time as all my upper division classes will have to be pushed back one semester.

 

I emailed the CS Enrollment Department expressing this concern, but they said that everyone on the waitlist had some special consideration. Additionally, they mentioned that there were seniors who were forced to delay their graduation and take another semester if they couldn't get into this class.

 

It strikes me as inconsiderate that the administration released this information after priority enrollment had passed; I'm sure if we knew otherwise, upperclassmen would have phase 1'ed the course. 

 

I also find it hard to understand why class size should be the issue for this course. CS61A has nearly 2,000 students and use the same lecture hall (Wheeler 150) as CS C8. Labs and grading may still be problematic, but they are addressable if there is a will, especially considering the dire consequences on the student side and the late notification of capped enrollment.

 

If you agree, please submit the poll below. The poll is anonymous to everyone (including instructors, if you're afraid of backlash). While it's not a guarantee to do anything, at least we made an honest attempt.
history.subject: Petition to Expand CS C8 Fall 2019 Class

history.content:
Hello!

 

I am a sophomore, currently #2 on the waitlist for my lab in CS C8, and I want to start a petition to expand the CS C8 class.

 

While I already know that administration has closed the class, I have found the reasons insufficient, and heard many on the wait list in dire situation, and am thus asking for another reconsideration.

 

I phase 2'ed CS C8 because I, like many other students, was under the impression that it would be expanded like CS61A and CS61B to accommodate all its students. Given its popularity (as well as it being a lower division requirement for the Data Science major as well as an introductory course to CS61A) and precedents of accommodating all wishing, my assumption was not groundless.

 

Yet the first Piazza post that announced that CS C8 would not be expanded came after phase 1. Had I known that the class would not be enlarged, I would have phase 1'ed it as I need it to declare my Data Science major this semester. Now if I don't take the class this semester I won't be able to graduate on time as all my upper division classes will have to be pushed back one semester.

 

I emailed the CS Enrollment Department expressing this concern, but they said that everyone on the waitlist had some special consideration. Additionally, they mentioned that there were seniors who were forced to delay their graduation and take another semester if they couldn't get into this class.

 

It strikes me as inconsiderate that the administration released this information after priority enrollment had passed; I'm sure if we knew otherwise, upperclassmen would have phase 1'ed the course. 

 

I also find it hard to understand why class size should be the issue for this course. CS61A has nearly 2,000 students and use the same lecture hall (Wheeler 150) as CS C8. Labs and grading may still be problematic, but they are addressable if there is a will, especially considering the dire consequences on the student side and the late notification of capped enrollment.

 

If you agree, please submit the poll below. The poll is anonymous to everyone (including instructors, if you're afraid of backlash). While it's not a guarantee to do anything, at least we made an honest attempt.
history.subject: Petition to Expand CS C8 Fall 2019 Class

answers.text: I'd like to sign this petition.
